alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:55PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Floyd and west central Franklin Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Terrys Fork, or near Pilot, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Copper Hill... Ferrum... Terrys Fork... Check... and Callaway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
